alert.note: Alert for Newton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:03PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Alcovy River near Alcovy River below Covington affecting Newton County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and expected to continue. * WHERE...Alcovy River near Alcovy River below Covington. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins of woodlands and fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Henderson Mill Road. The water level reaches the first wooden step behind an elevated private residence just upstream and on the left bank from the bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM EST Wednesday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. late tonight at 515 AM EST.
